I'm Sudarsan

Mechanical/Product Design Engineer with cross-disciplinary strength in robotics, automation, and mechatronics. Passionate about designing future-ready systems.

Experience Projects Skills Contact Me
More About Me

About Me

Hi! I'm Sudarsan Srinivasan, a passionate Mechanical and Product Design Engineer with over 3.5 years of experience in the automotive industry, currently advancing my expertise through a Master's in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Washington.

My core strength lies in combining mechanical design (CAD, DFM/DFA, GD&T, FEA) with cross-disciplinary capabilities in mechatronics, robotics, and automation — building solutions that are not only robust but also intelligent and future-ready.

At Bajaj Auto, I contributed to full-vehicle programs, driving innovations across engine systems, structural components, and cost-saving initiatives. Now, I'm expanding into robotics, control systems, and automation design through projects and research that fuse mechanical engineering with cutting-edge technology.

Core Highlights:

  • Mechanical Design: Siemens NX, SolidWorks, CATIA, DFM/DFA, GD&T
  • Simulation & Analysis: ANSYS, HyperWorks, FEA, DFMEA, DVP
  • Robotics & Controls: MATLAB, Simulink, ROS, Python, C++
  • Quality & Optimization: VAVE, cost reduction, design validation, supplier collaboration

I'm eager to shape the future of mechanical products by blending design excellence with automation intelligence. Let's connect!

Experience

Boeing Advanced Research Collaboration @ UW

Mechanical Design CAD Modeling (Solidworks) System Integration Cross-functional Collaboration Material Selection IP65 Design Actuator Design

Leading mechanical design for an autonomous cleaning robot for non-destructive inspection water tank cells

Bajaj Auto Limited

Mechanical Design Siemens NX GD&T Die casting Injection molding Machining DFM/DFA FEA (ANSYS, HyperView) 8D Root Cause Analysis DFMEA, DVP, DRBFM Cross functional Collaboration NXOpen Automation VAVE

As a Mechanical Design Engineer, I led design and development of aluminum castings, plastic covers, gaskets - both metal & fiber, and sheet metal brackets, for ICE (2Wh) and EV platforms (3Wh), adhering to regulatory norms, styling, DFMEA, and production feasibility for high-volume production

Ashok Leyland

Process Optimization SOP and WIS documentation Quality Control Data collection and Analysis Pareto chart analysis Documentation Cross-functional Collaboration

Worked on two key projects to improve commercial vehicle manufacturing processes - focused on assembly line process optimization and quality improvements.

Rane TRW Steering Systems

Time study analysis Process optimization Design Engineering CAD Modeling Product Validation SolidWorks for CAD design On-ground implementation and testing

As an intern, focus was on optimizing the drop-arm painting process.Achieved significant improvements in production efficiency and output through process analysis and custom equipment design.

Projects

Modeling Heat Transfer in Metal Quenching using Peridynamic Continuum Modeling

MATLAB Peridynamics Heat Transfer Modeling

Developed and validated a Peridynamic heat transfer model to analyze temperature profiles during metal quenching, extending classical DC casting theories.

Safe End-Effector Trajectory Tracking for a 2-DOF Robotic Arm

MATLAB Simulink Control Theory

Designed a CLF-CBF QP controller to ensure safe and stable trajectory tracking under dynamic constraints.
